 Get mixed audio from the mixer.

Detailed Description

an audio mixer has a number of channels that supply it with audio. the mixer mixes the samples together as a sum of the input samples.

Member Function Documentation

audiochannel * audiomixer::channel (  unsigned short  index  ) 
 

Returns an audiochannel object for the requested index.

This allows access to the audiochannel object for a given index This is needed to allow audio to be loaded, and to perform operations such as play, pause, stop, seek, etc

Parameters:
index Specifies the index of the channel required
Returns:
Pointer to audiochannel object

void audiomixer::createChannel (   ) 
 

Adds a new channel to the audio mixer.

This creates a new audiochannel object. This audiochannel can then be accessed using the channel routine

void audiomixer::destroyChannel (  unsigned short  index  ) 
 

Deletes an existing channel from the audio mixer.

The associated audiochannel object is deleted and memory freed

Parameters:
index Specifies the index of the channel to delete

void audiomixer::getAudio (  char *  mix_buffer,
unsigned int  size
) 
 

Get mixed audio from the mixer.

Returns a block of mixed audio samples of user specified size into a user allocated buffer. It is guaranteed to fill the buffer, filling it with zero-ed samples if there is no input to the mixer.

Parameters:
mix_buffer a user allocated buffer of length size
size length of mix_buffer in octets.
